channel.title: Messages on yeis.dev
channel.description: Recent content in Messages on yeis.dev

item.description: I just learned that the development of Onivim 2 has gone stale. It’s very sad to see that happen.
Got 100 points for the first time in Wingspan, 104 to be exact. That feels good!
Big Fin is gone today. RIP.
Finally, I’ve started to play Wingspan. It’s definitely a beautiful game, and I’m going to get a physical copy later this year.
Great minds discuss ideas; average minds discuss events; small minds dicuss people. – Eleanor Roosevelt
Skip the new Space Jam movie unless you’re a LeBron fan.
Bucks won NBA Finals 2021. Giannis had a monstrous performance. Respect. Well deserved champion.
Got into Polywork! Say hi to me there :)
Watched Onward last night, it’s another good movie from Pixar!
I just got the invite to GitHub Copilot, but the issue preventing me from using vscode as my main editor is still there not fixed after a few years…

There is a moisture sensor inside Dynson v10 (other models probably have it as well) to protect the motor from minor water damage. If you accidentally put a wet filter on and the vacuum refuses to work afterwards, don’t panic and don’t throw it away just yet, leave it and let it dry for 2 - 3 days, there is a good chance it will come back to life again.
Just discovered a very useful tool bundlephobia. It’s a package analyzer to show the composition of the package so you know clearly what you’re actually paying for when bringing in a dependency.
Really into Root now. Still learning how to play, but I’ve already fallen in love, can’t stop thinking about it!

I’ve been working with ProseMirror for the last few days, it’s a nicely designed and well built toolkit to build editor on web. I am genuinely excited and want to learn more about it. I haven’t had such feeling for a long time.

I feel Relay at this moment is like Flux in the early days of React. It’s powerful and shows the abilities of GraphQL; but, it’s not very easy to understand and use, the learning curve is steep. You have to go through quite a few hurdles before you can enjoy the benefits that Relay brings to the table.

I’ve switched to JetBrains IDEs two years ago as a life-long vimer and thought I would never forget how to develop in vanilla vim. However, yesterday when I fired up the unconfigured vim to write a small dart program, I couldn’t. I felt it was so hard to type without auto-completion and I wanted to use an IDE or vscode. That scared me. I need to jump out my comfortable zone and practice my programming skill more without the help from the tools.
My Logitech G903 has had the double-click issue for awhile, today I finally pulled out my solder iron and changed the micro switch!
Got my first “Aha!” moment with Relay after staring at it for a few weeks.
I’ve started to use tokyo60, need some time to get used to it after using Preonic for awhile now.
The double clicking issue on my G903 has became unbearable, it’s time to open it up, pull my soldering iron out, and change the switches!

I’ve started to watch Star Wars films from the beginning. I initially was afraid that it would be hard to bear because older movies are very slow, but it turned out to be the other way around. I was hooked on the story after the first 15 minutes and couldn’t help but finished the whole Episode IV in one run. It’s not like other recent films which I need to break one up to smaller pieces to consume.
Recently tried esbuild, my experience with it is very positive, it’s so much faster and easier to use than webpack.
Started the brand new M1 yesterday morning at 85% battery, went through all the downloads and installations, now it still has 40%. Very impressive!

I missed today’s Move goal. It was just a small gap to close, 20 minutes walk would make it, but I procrastinated until it was too late… Words to myself: this situation has happened too many times, the lesson should have been learned already, don’t let it happen again.
I just did a coffee dripper comparison between the V60 and the Origami, and consumed about 500ml coffee in the middle of the night. Hope I can still get a good sleep tonight.

OK, I got the Kinu M47 Classic. A lot sooner than I originally planned, and it costed me a fortune, but… OMG! Day and night isn’t enough to describe the difference between the Kinu and my $20 grinder; it’s a different world.
Despite how much I like dart, I think it’s a mistake to build Flutter on dart. Just imagine Flutter was using JavaScript at the beginning, it would be a lot more popular by now.
Got my reMarkable 2 yesterday! It’s my 2nd e-ink display device since the Kindle 2nd-Gen. Writing on it feels great and reading PDFs on the big screen is so much better than on smaller devices.
After gettting the Hario V60, I have consumed too much coffee and spent too much money on grinders.
Learning pour over now!
I have researched coffee brewing for 2 nights and purchased the Hario V60 kit. Yep, I’m starting a new hobby.
Maybe it’s just me but I feel it’s a shame that a man needs to find a new job working for other people in order to have a better income.
Now I’m used to the ortholinear layout, typing on the staggered layout has became a problem for me. It’s time to practice the “switching”.
This message is composed in the GitHub Codespaces!
After a week with the Preonic, I’m fully adjusted to the ortholinear keyboard. Absolutely love it!
Writing this message on the Preonic, I have to admit that learning a new keyboard layout is hard and no fun.
One of the disks died last Friday, and my whole Labor Day long weekend was toasted.
OMG! OG Anunoby, what a shot! Lowry, what a pass!
I’m 100% hooked with Harry Potter movies. I don’t why I wasn’t interested in it when it just came out.
A good set of keycaps can really make the typing experience so much better. No more $20 set for me.
Start to study Technical Analysis of Stock Trends. Wish me luck!
I have wanted to join 5AM club for a long time. I tried it this morning. I am very tired and feeling terrible now.
NBA restarted! It’s good to have the games back!
Purchased Crysis Remastered on my Switch! Let’s see what it’s all about.
I’ve decided to rebuild Gemsby’s chat tool with Svelte. Let’s see how it goes.
The Space Force is a pretty good show to watch during this stressful time.
Apple Silicon: Hello World! Intel: ðŸ˜­
Installed WirdGuard on PI4. The configuration is so simple compare to other VPN solutions, and the iOS app is very nice. I absolutely love it!

Pulled out my Kindle 2nd Gen over the weekend, charged it, then started reading on it. I’m happily surprised that despite of its slow speed, the reading experience is so great, way better than the other phones and tablet I own. Hopefully this time I’ll put it into a good use, instead of just sitting there collecting dust.
Westworld s3 is good, especially when considering what is happening in the world right now.
I’m going to learn svelte this week.
Applied the position of the Tailwind UI team. Fingers crossedðŸ¤ž

It seems there is a rising demand of a notes taking app to write in markdown and save the notes as markdown text files. That sounds just like what hugo does. I’ll try to use hugo for that purpose, and see how it goes.
Wrap to Column is the plugin of JetBrains IDEs you’ll need if you need to wrap the comments in a different width than the code.
I’ve played with deno for awhile today, it seems to be very promising.
My tax return is done early this year! Woohoo!
Fever, broken foot, gout, broken arm. That’s a hell of a week!
I couldn’t hold myself off any longer, I’ve started to watch The Last Dance!

Just read Second-guessing the modern web. It’s a well written article on the current trend of building static content site with React SPA. I agree with it, that’s why this very site is still built with Hugo despite my familiarity with React and the recent hype of Gatsby.
New design is up! WOOHOO!
I didn’t have too much memory of The Matrix Revolutions, and I didn’t expect it to be very good before re-watching it. But, man, I’ve enjoyed it a lot, it IS good!
Matrix movie series are so fun to (re)watch!
